3. PRODUCT/SERVICE STRENGTHS — Their top 3 genuinely strong features or advantages
4. WEAKNESSES & GAPS — Where they fall short, based on public reviews, customer complaints, or market feedback
5. PRICING STRATEGY — Their pricing model and how it compares to market expectations
6. MARKETING CHANNELS — Where and how they acquire customers
7. CONTENT & MESSAGING — The tone, themes, and storytelling they use

Then provide a synthesis:
- COMPETITIVE MATRIX: Compare all competitors across 8 key dimensions in a table
- WHITESPACE OPPORTUNITIES: The 3 uncontested positioning angles my business could own
- RECOMMENDED STRATEGY: My clearest path to differentiation based on the analysis

prompts.title: Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) Builder
prompts.prompt:
You are an operations consultant and process design expert. Create a detailed, professional Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) document for [PROCESS/TASK] in [BUSINESS TYPE].

The SOP must include:
1. TITLE & PURPOSE — Clear name and one-paragraph explanation of why this process exists and what it achieves
2. SCOPE — Who this SOP applies to and when it is used
3. ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES — List of everyone involved and their specific role in this process
4. TOOLS & RESOURCES REQUIRED — Software, materials, access, or templates needed before starting
5. STEP-BY-STEP PROCESS — Numbered steps with sub-steps, written clearly enough that a new team member with no prior context can execute perfectly
6. DECISION TREE — Key decision points in the process with clear if/then paths
7. QUALITY CHECKS — Built-in checkpoints to ensure the process is being done correctly
8. COMMON MISTAKES — Top 3 errors people make and how to avoid them
9. KPIs — How success is measured for this process
10. REVISION LOG — Template for tracking future updates

Format the SOP for easy scanning and immediate use.

prompts.title: Facebook & Instagram Ad Copy Generator (Full Funnel)
prompts.prompt:
You are a performance marketing copywriter who specializes in paid social ads with proven ROAS. Write a complete ad copy set for [PRODUCT/SERVICE] targeting [AUDIENCE DESCRIPTION] with a budget goal of [OBJECTIVE: Awareness/Leads/Sales].

Generate ad copy for 3 funnel stages:

TOF (Top of Funnel — Cold Audience):
- 3 scroll-stopping hooks (1 line each)
- Primary text (3 versions: problem-led, curiosity-led, story-led — each under 150 words)
- Headline (3 options, under 40 characters)
- Description (under 30 characters)

MOF (Middle of Funnel — Warm/Retargeting):
- 2 primary text versions addressing objections and building trust (150 words each)
- Testimonial-format ad

BOF (Bottom of Funnel — Hot/Purchase-ready):
- 2 urgency/offer-driven primary texts
- 3 urgency CTAs
- A 'last chance' retargeting ad

For all copy: no fluff, no vague claims. Include specific proof points, concrete benefits over features, and mirror the exact language [AUDIENCE] uses about their problem.

prompts.title: Winning Client Proposal Writer
prompts.prompt:
You are a senior freelance consultant and proposal writing expert. Write a professional, compelling client proposal for [SERVICE/PROJECT] for a client in [INDUSTRY] with the following project brief: [PASTE CLIENT BRIEF OR DESCRIBE THE PROJECT].

The proposal must include:
1. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY — 2-paragraph overview that restates the client's problem in their own language and previews the solution with confidence
2. UNDERSTANDING THE CHALLENGE — Show you've deeply understood their specific situation, goals, and constraints (this is what separates you from competitors)
3. PROPOSED APPROACH — Your strategic methodology, broken into clear phases with deliverables and milestones
4. TIMELINE — A realistic project timeline in weeks with key milestones
5. INVESTMENT — Pricing presented as a clear, justified investment rather than a cost (tiered options if relevant)
6. WHY ME/US — A 5-point brief on your unique experience, proof, and differentiators for this exact project
7. NEXT STEPS — A simple, low-friction CTA to move forward

Tone: Professional, confident, client-focused. Never desperate. Sound like you have other options too.

prompts.title: YouTube Video Script Writer (Hook to CTA)
prompts.prompt:
You are a YouTube content strategist and scriptwriter who has written for channels with 100k+ subscribers. Write a complete, ready-to-record YouTube video script on the topic: '[VIDEO TOPIC]' for an audience of [TARGET VIEWERS].

Video goal: [EDUCATE/ENTERTAIN/CONVERT TO LEAD/SELL PRODUCT]
Estimated length: [5-10 MIN / 10-15 MIN / 15-20 MIN]

Script structure:
- HOOK (First 15-30 seconds): Start in the middle of action, or lead with the most shocking/surprising/valuable thing in the video — make them stay
- INTRO (30-60 sec): Introduce yourself briefly, tease what they'll learn, and give them a reason to watch to the end
- MAIN CONTENT (broken into 3-5 clear sections with transitions): Teach the core material with examples, stories, demonstrations, and pattern interrupts every 60-90 seconds to maintain attention
- ENGAGEMENT PROMPT: Natural point to ask them to like/comment/subscribe (mid-video feels more authentic)
- CONCLUSION: Summarize key takeaways, deliver a memorable closing insight
- CTA: Clear, specific next step (subscribe, check link in description, watch next video)

Include [B-ROLL NOTES] in brackets throughout to guide visual production.

prompts.title: 90-Day Business Launch & Growth Plan
prompts.prompt:
You are a growth strategist and startup advisor. Create a detailed, week-by-week 90-Day Launch & Growth Plan for [BUSINESS/PRODUCT] targeting [AUDIENCE] with a budget of approximately [BUDGET RANGE].

Structure the plan in three 30-day phases:

PHASE 1 — FOUNDATION (Days 1-30):
- Core setup priorities (product, website, brand, tools)
- First customer acquisition strategy
- Week-by-week action checklist
- Target milestones by end of Phase 1

PHASE 2 — TRACTION (Days 31-60):
- First marketing channel to double down on based on Phase 1 data
- Content and community building strategy
- Sales and conversion optimization priorities
- Target milestones by end of Phase 2

PHASE 3 — SCALE (Days 61-90):
- Scaling what worked in Phase 2
- Adding a second acquisition channel
- Systematizing and documenting processes
- Target milestones by end of Phase 3

For each phase, also include:
- Top 3 priorities (not a list of 20 things)
- The #1 metric to track
- Common mistake to avoid in this phase
- Resource/tool recommendation

prompts.title: Personal Productivity System Designer
prompts.prompt:
You are a productivity expert and systems designer who has helped high-performers in business, creative work, and entrepreneurship build sustainable, results-driven daily systems. Design a completely personalized productivity system for me based on the following profile:

My situation: [DESCRIBE YOUR ROLE, GOALS, BIGGEST PRODUCTIVITY CHALLENGES, AND AVAILABLE HOURS PER DAY]

Design a system that includes:
1. IDEAL DAILY SCHEDULE — A time-blocked day template with energy management built in (deep work, shallow work, recovery)
2. WEEKLY REVIEW RITUAL — A step-by-step 30-minute weekly review process to stay aligned and course-correct
3. CAPTURE SYSTEM — How to collect tasks, ideas, and information so nothing falls through the cracks
4. PRIORITIZATION FRAMEWORK — A simple daily method to decide what to work on (not just urgent vs important)
5. FOCUS PROTOCOLS — Specific techniques to enter and sustain deep focus for [MY WORK TYPE]
6. ENERGY MANAGEMENT — Morning and end-of-day routines designed for my schedule
7. ANTI-PROCRASTINATION TRIGGERS — 3 specific tactics tailored to my profile
8. TOOLS STACK — Minimal, non-overwhelming tool recommendations with one-line purpose for each

Make the system realistic for someone who is already overwhelmed — it must be simple to maintain.

prompts.title: Brand Voice & Messaging Guide Creator
prompts.prompt:
You are a brand strategist and messaging architect. Create a comprehensive Brand Voice & Messaging Guide for [BRAND NAME] in the [INDUSTRY] space, targeting [TARGET AUDIENCE].

The guide must include:
1. BRAND PERSONALITY — Define the brand as if it were a person: 3 core personality traits, what it sounds like, what it NEVER sounds like, and 3 real-world brand analogies (e.g., 'We sound like X but not Y')
2. VOICE SPECTRUM — Plot the brand on 4 axis spectrums (e.g., Formal ↔ Casual, Serious ↔ Playful) with a brief justification for each placement
3. TONE VARIATIONS — How the brand voice adapts for different contexts: social media, email, customer support, product descriptions, and advertising
4. CORE MESSAGING PILLARS — 3 thematic messages the brand consistently reinforces, with 2-3 example statements for each
5. TAGLINE OPTIONS — 5 tagline options that capture the brand's essence
6. WORDS TO USE vs. WORDS TO AVOID — Two columns with 10 examples each
7. BEFORE/AFTER EXAMPLES — 3 rewrites showing weak/off-brand copy transformed into on-brand copy
8. THE BRAND'S MISSION STATEMENT — One paragraph that articulates purpose beyond profit

Make this guide immediately usable by a copywriter, designer, or social media manager.

prompts.title: High-Converting Product Description Writer
prompts.prompt:
You are a conversion-focused e-commerce copywriter who has written product descriptions for 7-figure Shopify and Amazon stores. Write a complete product listing for [PRODUCT NAME] targeting [TARGET BUYER PERSONA].

Product details: [PASTE PRODUCT SPECS, MATERIALS, DIMENSIONS, KEY FEATURES]

Deliver:
1. HEADLINE — Benefit-driven product title that includes primary keyword naturally
2. SHORT DESCRIPTION (50-80 words) — The emotional hook. Lead with the transformation this product creates, not the specs.
3. BULLET POINTS (5-7 bullets) — Each bullet leads with a bolded benefit, followed by a brief feature explanation. Use sensory language and address objections.
4. LONG DESCRIPTION (150-250 words) — Tell the product's story: who it's for, the problem it solves, why it was designed the way it is, and what the customer's life looks like after owning it.
5. SEO KEYWORDS — A list of 8-10 keywords to integrate into the listing
6. FAQ SECTION (3-5 questions) — Address the most common pre-purchase objections

Rules: No 'high-quality', 'premium', or other meaningless adjectives without proof. Every claim must be specific.

prompts.title: Landing Page Copy Writer (Full Page)
prompts.prompt:
You are a conversion rate optimization (CRO) specialist and landing page copywriter. Write complete landing page copy for [OFFER: product/service/lead magnet] targeting [AUDIENCE] with the goal of [CONVERSION GOAL: leads/sales/signups].

Deliver full copy for every section:
1. HERO SECTION — Headline (outcome-driven, not clever), subheadline (clarify + amplify), primary CTA button text
2. SOCIAL PROOF BAR — 3 credibility indicators (logos, numbers, awards, media mentions)
3. PROBLEM SECTION — Agitate the pain in 3-4 short paragraphs or bullets — make them feel seen
4. SOLUTION INTRO — Position the offer as the logical answer to the stated problem
5. FEATURES → BENEFITS — For each of 4-6 features, write the corresponding customer benefit in 1-2 sentences
6. HOW IT WORKS — 3-step process that makes the offer feel simple and achievable
7. TESTIMONIALS — 3 detailed, specific testimonial scripts with names, roles, and measurable results
8. OBJECTION HANDLING — FAQ section with 4-5 honest, direct answers
9. OFFER STACK — What they get, the value of each component, and the total value vs actual price
10. FINAL CTA — Urgency + reminder of transformation + CTA

Copy tone: Clear, confident, specific. Never corporate. Always human.

prompts.title: Weekly Newsletter Writer That Builds Loyal Readers
prompts.prompt:
You are an email newsletter strategist and writer who understands that great newsletters feel like letters from a smart friend, not content marketing. Write a complete, publication-ready newsletter issue for [NEWSLETTER NAME/BRAND] on the topic: [THIS WEEK'S TOPIC/THEME].

Audience: [DESCRIBE SUBSCRIBER PROFILE]
Newsletter tone/style: [e.g., Analytical & insightful / Warm & personal / Sharp & contrarian]

Structure the newsletter:
1. SUBJECT LINE — 3 options (curiosity gap, direct value, personal angle) with predicted open rate reasoning
2. PREHEADER TEXT — 90 characters that complement the subject line
3. OPENING — A personal anecdote, observation, or short story that leads naturally into the topic (100-150 words) — make readers feel like they're catching up with someone they trust
4. THE MAIN IDEA — Your core insight, framework, or argument with supporting points (300-500 words). Include one contrarian angle and one concrete example.
5. ONE THING TO TRY — A single, immediately actionable takeaway
6. CURATED LINKS — 3 external links framed with a one-sentence opinion on each
7. CLOSING — Personal, warm, memorable — not 'see you next week'
8. PS LINE — One curiosity hook teasing next issue's content

Do NOT sound like a content robot. Sound like a human who thinks deeply.

prompts.title: Sales Call Script & Objection Handler
prompts.prompt:
You are a master sales trainer and closer with expertise in consultative selling. Create a complete sales call framework and script for selling [PRODUCT/SERVICE] at a price point of [PRICE] to [BUYER PROFILE].

Deliver:
1. PRE-CALL PREP CHECKLIST — 5 things to research and prepare before every call
2. CALL STRUCTURE — A timed framework (e.g., 45-min call broken into phases with time allocations)
3. OPENING — Word-for-word opening that builds rapport and sets a collaborative frame (not a pitch frame)
4. DISCOVERY QUESTIONS — 8-10 open-ended questions designed to surface pain, urgency, and buying motivation (with follow-up probes for each)
5. THE PITCH — How to present the solution after discovery, tying it directly to what was said in discovery (not a generic pitch)
6. OBJECTION HANDLING PLAYBOOK — Full scripts for the 6 most common objections:
   - 'It's too expensive'
   - 'I need to think about it'
   - 'I need to talk to my partner/boss'
   - 'I'm not ready yet'
   - 'I've tried similar things before'
   - 'Can you send me more information?'
7. THE CLOSE — 2 natural closing approaches that don't feel pressuring
8. NEXT STEP SCRIPT — How to end the call with a clear commitment regardless of outcome

prompts.title: LinkedIn Post Writer — Thought Leadership Series
prompts.prompt:
You are a LinkedIn content strategist who has helped founders, executives, and creators build audiences of 50k+ followers. Write a series of 5 high-performing LinkedIn posts for [PERSON'S ROLE/EXPERTISE] on the theme of [CONTENT THEME].

For each post:
- A hook (first 1-2 lines that make people click 'see more') — this is the most important part
- Body content with short paragraphs (1-2 sentences each), natural line breaks, and a clear flow
- One personal insight or experience that makes it feel authentic, not generic
- A strong CTA at the end (comment, share, DM, link)
- Estimated engagement type (saves, comments, shares, reach)

Post variety (one of each):
1. PERSONAL STORY POST — A specific experience with a lesson that applies broadly
2. CONTRARIAN TAKE — A belief you hold that most in your industry disagree with
3. FRAMEWORK/LIST POST — A numbered breakdown of a concept that provides immediate value
4. BEHIND-THE-SCENES POST — A transparent look at your process, decision, or reality
5. ENGAGEMENT POST — A question or prompt that invites genuine discussion

Style: Conversational, punchy, human. Never corporate. No emojis overload. No 'I'm excited to share'.

prompts.title: Online Course Curriculum Designer
prompts.prompt:
You are an instructional designer and online course expert who has helped creators generate $1M+ in digital product revenue. Design a complete, sellable online course on the topic: '[COURSE TOPIC]' for students who are [BEGINNER/INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED] in [FIELD].

Students' main goal: [WHAT TRANSFORMATION THEY WANT]
Delivery format: [VIDEO / TEXT / LIVE / HYBRID]
Ideal course length: [X HOURS]

Deliver:
1. COURSE TITLE — 3 compelling, benefit-driven title options
2. COURSE PROMISE — One sentence stating the exact outcome students will achieve
3. TARGET STUDENT PROFILE — Who this is for and who it's NOT for (both matter for positioning)
4. COURSE MODULES (6-10) — For each module:
   - Module title
   - Learning objective (what students will be able to DO after this module)
   - 4-6 lesson titles with a 1-sentence description of each
   - One engagement element (exercise, quiz, template, or discussion prompt)
5. QUICK WIN — Which lesson in Module 1 delivers the fastest, most tangible result (this drives completion and reviews)
6. BONUS IDEAS — 3 bonus resources that enhance value without being essential to the core
7. COURSE PRICING STRATEGY — Recommended price point and tiered pricing rationale
8. SALES PAGE HEADLINE — 3 options for the course's main marketing headline

prompts.title: Investor Pitch Deck Story & Script Writer
prompts.prompt:
You are a startup advisor and pitch deck strategist who has helped founders raise seed and Series A funding. Write the complete narrative, talking points, and slide content for a 10-12 slide investor pitch deck for [STARTUP NAME] — a [ONE LINE BUSINESS DESCRIPTION] in the [INDUSTRY] space.

For each slide, provide:
- Slide title
- Key visual/data point to show (describe in text)
- Talking points (what to SAY, not just what the slide shows)
- The 'so what' — why this slide matters to an investor

Slide sequence:
1. COVER — Company name, tagline, presenter name
2. THE PROBLEM — Make investors feel the pain of the problem viscerally
3. THE SOLUTION — Simple, clear, 'aha' explanation of what you do
4. WHY NOW — The market forces making this the right time for this business
5. MARKET SIZE — TAM/SAM/SOM with a bottom-up calculation
6. BUSINESS MODEL — How you make money and unit economics
7. TRACTION — Metrics that prove you're onto something real
8. GO-TO-MARKET — How you'll acquire your first 1,000 customers
9. TEAM — Why you and your team are uniquely suited to win this
10. COMPETITION — Positioning matrix showing your differentiated angle
11. FINANCIALS — 3-year projections with key assumptions
12. THE ASK — Funding amount, use of funds breakdown, and next milestone

prompts.title: Brand Story & Origin Story Crafter
prompts.prompt:
You are a brand storyteller and narrative strategist. Craft a compelling, emotionally resonant Brand Origin Story for [BRAND NAME] based on the following founder information: [DESCRIBE: Who founded it, what triggered the idea, what problem they personally experienced, what obstacles they faced, what breakthrough moment changed everything].

Create three versions of the story:

1. THE ELEVATOR VERSION (60 words) — The version told at networking events: punchy, memorable, human
2. THE WEBSITE ABOUT PAGE VERSION (250-350 words) — The full narrative arc: the 'before', the crisis moment, the insight, the solution built, and the mission going forward. Written in second person occasionally ('You probably know this feeling...')
3. THE LONG-FORM EMAIL VERSION (500-600 words) — The deeper story sent to new subscribers or warm leads. Include vulnerability, specificity, and a moment of doubt. End with why the business exists and what the reader can expect.

For all versions:
- Use specific details, not vague generalities
- Create one memorable 'origin scene' that anchors the story
- Connect the founder's personal journey to the reader's current situation
- Never start with 'I started this company because...'

Also provide: 3 short pull quotes from the story that could be used in social media or ads.

prompts.title: Strategic Decision-Making Framework Generator
prompts.prompt:
You are a decision intelligence expert and executive coach. Help me make a high-quality decision about [DESCRIBE THE DECISION YOU FACE] using a structured, multi-lens analysis framework.

Conduct a full decision analysis covering:
1. DECISION DEFINITION — Restate the decision clearly, including what's actually being decided and by when
2. CRITERIA MATRIX — Identify the 5-7 most important criteria for evaluating this decision, weighted by importance (1-10)
3. OPTIONS INVENTORY — List all realistic options including the non-obvious ones and the 'do nothing' option
4. PRE-MORTEM ANALYSIS — For the top 2-3 options: imagine it's 1 year later and the decision was a failure. What went wrong? (This surfaces hidden risks)
5. SECOND-ORDER CONSEQUENCES — What happens after what happens? Map 2nd-order effects of the top options
6. REVERSIBILITY ASSESSMENT — Rate each option on how reversible it is if it turns out to be wrong
7. VALUES ALIGNMENT CHECK — Which option is most consistent with your stated priorities and long-term goals?
8. RECOMMENDATION — Based on the analysis, which option scores highest and why
9. IMPLEMENTATION FIRST STEP — If you proceed with the recommended option, what is the single next action within 48 hours?

Be analytical but acknowledge uncertainty honestly.

prompts.title: Podcast Episode Planner & Show Notes Writer
prompts.prompt:
You are a podcast producer and content strategist. Create a complete episode plan and all associated content for a podcast episode on the topic: '[EPISODE TOPIC]' for [PODCAST NAME] targeting [LISTENER AUDIENCE].

Episode format: [SOLO/INTERVIEW/PANEL]
Approximate length: [X minutes]
Guest (if applicable): [NAME, TITLE, BACKGROUND]

Deliver the following:
1. EPISODE TITLE — 3 SEO-optimized, click-worthy episode title options
2. EPISODE HOOK — A 30-second cold open script to play before the intro music
3. INTERVIEW QUESTIONS (if applicable) — 15 questions organized from rapport-building to deep insights to memorable closing question
4. EPISODE OUTLINE — Segmented structure with time stamps for each section
5. KEY SOUNDBITES — 5 moments in the outline likely to generate clips for social media
6. SHOW NOTES (300-400 words) — SEO-friendly show notes with guest bio, key topics covered, and timestamp breakdown
7. EPISODE DESCRIPTION — Two versions: short (50 words for podcast apps) and long (150 words for website)
8. SOCIAL MEDIA PROMOTION — 3 social posts to promote the episode (one per platform: LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter/X)
9. NEWSLETTER BLURB — 80-word email teaser for your subscriber list
10. CTA STRATEGY — 2 different CTAs to test in the episode

prompts.title: Value-Based Pricing Strategy Builder
prompts.prompt:
You are a pricing strategist and business model consultant. Help me design and justify a value-based pricing strategy for [PRODUCT/SERVICE] offered to [TARGET CUSTOMER SEGMENT].

Conduct a full pricing analysis:
1. VALUE MAPPING — What specific, quantifiable outcomes does your product/service deliver? (Time saved, revenue gained, cost avoided, risk reduced) — express these in dollar terms where possible
2. CUSTOMER VALUE CALCULATION — Walk through an example of the ROI a customer gets, using realistic numbers
3. COMPETITIVE PRICING LANDSCAPE — What do alternatives (including doing nothing) cost the customer?
4. WILLINGNESS TO PAY SEGMENTATION — Identify 3 buyer segments with different willingness to pay and what drives the difference
5. PRICING MODEL RECOMMENDATION — Choose and justify the best pricing model (flat fee, subscription, usage-based, tiered, per-seat, etc.) for this context
6. PRICE POINT RECOMMENDATION — A specific recommended price with psychological pricing rationale
7. TIER STRUCTURE (if applicable) — Design 3 tiers (e.g., Starter/Growth/Pro) with what's included at each level
8. ANCHORING STRATEGY — How to present pricing to make the target option feel like the obvious choice
9. COMMON PRICING MISTAKES TO AVOID — For this type of business/product
10. A/B TESTING PLAN — What to test first to optimize pricing over time

prompts.title: Annual Goal Setting & Life Design System
prompts.prompt:
You are a certified life and executive coach specializing in high-performance goal achievement. Help me design a comprehensive Annual Goal Setting System for [CURRENT YEAR] based on my situation: [DESCRIBE YOUR CURRENT LIFE SITUATION, MAIN ROLES, AND WHAT MATTERS MOST TO YOU].

Guide me through a full system:
1. LIFE AUDIT — Rate current satisfaction (1-10) across 8 life domains: Health, Career/Business, Finances, Relationships, Personal Growth, Fun/Recreation, Contribution, Spirituality/Meaning
2. VISION CASTING — Help me write a vivid 1-year vision statement for the 3 domains with the lowest scores
3. GOAL SETTING (SMART+) — For each of 3 priority domains, write a SMART goal enhanced with:
   - The deeper 'WHY' behind it
   - A leading indicator to track weekly
   - A lagging indicator to measure monthly
4. OBSTACLE ANTICIPATION — For each goal, identify the top 2 obstacles and a pre-planned 'if-then' response
5. QUARTERLY MILESTONES — Break each annual goal into 4 quarterly milestones
6. WEEKLY HABITS — Identify 1-2 weekly habits that directly drive each goal
7. ACCOUNTABILITY SYSTEM — Design a 15-minute weekly and 30-minute monthly review ritual
8. IDENTITY STATEMENT — For each goal, write an identity-based affirmation (not 'I want to...' but 'I am a person who...')
9. 90-DAY SPRINT PLAN — First 90 days: the 3 most important actions across all goals

prompts.title: Complete SEO Content Strategy Builder
prompts.prompt:
You are an SEO strategist and content marketing expert. Build a comprehensive SEO content strategy for [WEBSITE/BUSINESS] in the [NICHE/INDUSTRY] space targeting [TARGET AUDIENCE].

Deliverable: A complete content strategy document covering:
1. KEYWORD UNIVERSE — Organize keyword opportunities into 5 topic clusters with:
   - Pillar keyword (high volume, high competition)
   - 5-8 supporting keywords per cluster (long-tail, lower competition)
   - Estimated search intent for each (informational/navigational/commercial/transactional)
2. CONTENT CALENDAR — A 3-month publishing schedule with:
   - Article titles
   - Target keyword
   - Recommended content type (pillar guide, listicle, comparison, tutorial, case study)
   - Priority ranking
3. CONTENT BRIEF TEMPLATE — For the #1 priority article, write a full content brief including: target keyword, secondary keywords, search intent, recommended structure, key questions to answer, competing URLs to research, and recommended word count
4. INTERNAL LINKING PLAN — Map how the content pieces link to each other
5. QUICK WIN OPPORTUNITIES — 3 low-competition keywords where new content could rank within 90 days
6. ON-PAGE SEO CHECKLIST — Standard checklist to apply to every piece of content
7. BACKLINK STRATEGY — 3 realistic link-building tactics for this niche

prompts.title: Business Automation Opportunity Finder
prompts.prompt:
You are an operations and automation consultant who helps businesses reclaim 10-20 hours per week by eliminating manual, repetitive work. Conduct a Business Automation Audit for [BUSINESS TYPE] with [TEAM SIZE] people currently handling [MAIN BUSINESS FUNCTIONS].

Deliver a complete automation roadmap:
1. PROCESS INVENTORY — List the 15 most common manual tasks in a business like this, organized by department (Marketing, Sales, Operations, Finance, Customer Success)
2. AUTOMATION PRIORITY MATRIX — Evaluate each process on:
   - Time consumed per week
   - Repetitiveness (can it be automated?)
   - Error rate when done manually
   - Business impact if automated
3. TOP 5 AUTOMATION WINS — The 5 highest-impact automations to implement first with:
   - The exact process to automate
   - Recommended tool(s) (Zapier, Make, n8n, specific SaaS)
   - Estimated time saved per week
   - Implementation complexity (Easy/Medium/Hard)
   - A plain-English description of how the automation works
4. QUICK WINS (Implement in <1 hour each) — 5 micro-automations that require almost no technical skill
5. AI LEVERAGE POINTS — Where AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, Notion AI, etc.) could replace manual cognitive work
6. ROI CALCULATION — Estimated hours saved per month × team cost rate = monthly value of automation program
7. IMPLEMENTATION ROADMAP — Week-by-week plan for the first 30 days

prompts.title: Side Hustle Launch Planner Based on Your Skills
prompts.prompt:
You are a business coach and digital income strategist who specializes in helping people build $1,000–$5,000/month side incomes leveraging their existing skills. Based on the following profile, design a complete Side Hustle Launch Plan:

My skills and experience: [LIST YOUR TOP 3-5 SKILLS]
Time available per week: [X hours]
Financial goal: [$X/month within X months]
Preferred work style: [e.g., service-based, product-based, content-based, community-based]

Deliver:
1. TOP 3 SIDE HUSTLE MATCHES — Ranked by fit with your profile, income potential, and time-to-first-dollar
2. DEEP DIVE ON #1 RECOMMENDATION — Full business model: what you offer, who you serve, how you price it, and how you find your first 5 clients
3. 30-DAY LAUNCH PLAN — Week-by-week actions to go from idea to first paying customer
4. EARNINGS PROJECTION — Realistic Month 1, Month 3, and Month 6 income projections with assumptions shown
5. PLATFORM STRATEGY — Where to find clients or customers for this specific hustle
6. STARTER PORTFOLIO/PROOF — How to get credibility before you have paying clients (samples, testimonials, case studies)
7. COMMON FAILURE POINTS — The #1 reason people fail with this type of side hustle and how to avoid it
8. SCALE PATH — What this looks like if it grows into a full-time business

prompts.title: Science-Based Habit Building System
prompts.prompt:
You are a behavioral psychologist and habit design coach. Help me build and stick to the following habit(s): [LIST 1-3 HABITS YOU WANT TO BUILD] given my current situation: [DESCRIBE YOUR DAILY ROUTINE, BIGGEST OBSTACLES, AND PAST ATTEMPTS].

Apply habit science (James Clear's Atomic Habits, BJ Fogg's Tiny Habits, and behavioral psychology) to design:
1. HABIT AUDIT — Identify my current routine 'anchor points' that new habits can attach to
2. HABIT STACKING PLAN — Design a specific habit stack (After I [EXISTING HABIT], I will [NEW HABIT]) for each desired habit
3. ENVIRONMENT DESIGN — Specific changes to my physical environment to make each habit obvious and frictionless
4. MINIMUM VIABLE HABIT — The smallest possible version of each habit that still creates the neural pathway (start so small it's embarrassing to skip)
5. REWARD DESIGN — Immediate rewards to create a satisfying feeling after completing each habit (not food-based unless specifically relevant)
6. OBSTACLE PLAN — The 3 most likely reasons I'll skip and a specific 'if-then' plan for each
7. TRACKING SYSTEM — The simplest possible tracking method (one metric, one app, or one paper system per habit)
8. RAMP-UP SCHEDULE — How to gradually increase the habit's intensity over 60 days
9. IDENTITY SHIFT — The new identity statement to adopt that makes these habits feel natural: 'I am a person who...'
10. 30-DAY MILESTONE — What progress looks like at Day 30 so I can feel the win

prompts.title: Twitter/X Growth Content Pack (30 Viral-Optimized Tweets)
prompts.prompt:
You are a Twitter/X growth strategist who has helped accounts grow from 0 to 10,000+ followers. Write a pack of 30 high-performing tweets for [ACCOUNT NICHE/TOPIC] targeting [IDEAL FOLLOWER TYPE].

Create 5 tweets in each of these 6 high-performing formats:

1. ONE-LINER WISDOM TWEETS — Single sentences that are profound, quotable, or shareable (optimized for retweets)
2. THREAD HOOKS — First tweet of a thread that makes people click 'Show this thread' (end with 'Here's how👇' or similar)
3. CONTROVERSIAL TAKES — Defensible contrarian opinions that will generate debate and discussion
4. STORYTELLING TWEETS — A mini-story in 2-4 short paragraphs with a twist or lesson at the end
5. VALUE BOMB TWEETS — A numbered list of 3-7 actionable insights in one tweet format
6. ENGAGEMENT TWEETS — Questions, 'this or that' choices, or fill-in-the-blank prompts that get replies

For each tweet:
- Write the tweet (under 280 characters, unless thread hook)
- Label the format type
- Rate virality potential: High/Medium with one-line reason

Style guide: Punchy. No hashtag spam. No cringe motivational quotes. Sounds like a sharp, knowledgeable person — not a brand account.

prompts.title: Complete Customer Onboarding Email Sequence
prompts.prompt:
You are a customer success and email marketing specialist. Write a complete post-purchase customer onboarding email sequence for [PRODUCT/SERVICE] for customers who just purchased/subscribed.

Goal: Reduce churn, drive product adoption, generate reviews, and create loyal repeat customers.

Write 6 emails:

Email 1 — WELCOME (Send immediately): Warm, personal welcome that confirms their great decision, delivers what they need to get started, and sets expectations. Subject line + full body.

Email 2 — QUICK WIN (Day 1): Guide them to the single fastest result they can achieve in the next 10 minutes. Frame it as their first success milestone. Subject line + full body.

Email 3 — FEATURE SPOTLIGHT (Day 3): Highlight the one most underutilized feature that dramatically changes outcomes. Show them what they're missing. Subject line + full body.

Email 4 — SOCIAL PROOF & COMMUNITY (Day 5): Share a customer success story that mirrors their situation. Invite them to join your community/group. Subject line + full body.

Email 5 — REVIEW REQUEST (Day 7): Honest, non-pushy request for a review or testimonial. Make it easy with a direct link and specific guidance on what to write. Subject line + full body.

Email 6 — UPSELL/CROSS-SELL (Day 14): When they're seeing results, introduce the next logical purchase. Frame it as 'the natural next step for people who've achieved X'. Subject line + full body.

Tone throughout: Warm, human, never transactional.

prompts.title: Lead Magnet Creator — Irresistible Free Offer
prompts.prompt:
You are a lead generation strategist and content creator. Design a complete, high-converting lead magnet for [BUSINESS/BRAND] targeting [IDEAL CUSTOMER DESCRIPTION] who struggles with [CORE PROBLEM].

Deliver:
1. LEAD MAGNET CONCEPT — 3 lead magnet format options (e.g., checklist, mini-guide, swipe file, template, quiz, video training) with a 1-line pitch for each and a recommended choice with rationale
2. TITLE OPTIONS — 5 compelling title options for the recommended lead magnet (using power words: 'Ultimate', 'Swipe', 'Blueprint', 'Checklist', 'Steal My', etc.)
3. COMPLETE CONTENT — Write the full lead magnet content in its entirety (formatted and ready to design):
   - Introduction (50-80 words)
   - Main content (structured, scannable, actionable)
   - Quick wins prominently featured
   - A teaser at the end for what comes next (soft introduction to paid offer)
4. OPT-IN PAGE COPY — Headline, 3-bullet benefit list, CTA button text, and privacy micro-copy
5. THANK-YOU PAGE SCRIPT — What to say/show immediately after they opt in to maximize the relationship start
6. PROMOTION STRATEGY — Top 3 channels to promote this lead magnet and a brief tactic for each

Goal: This lead magnet should deliver immediate value AND naturally lead the reader toward wanting the paid product.

prompts.title: Salary Negotiation Script & Strategy Coach
prompts.prompt:
You are a salary negotiation coach and career strategist who has helped professionals increase their compensation by 15-40%. Coach me through negotiating my salary for [JOB TITLE] at [COMPANY TYPE] in [CITY/REGION].

My situation: [DESCRIBE: Current/offer salary, your target, your years of experience, your key leverage points, and where you are in the negotiation process]

Deliver:
1. MARKET RESEARCH FRAMEWORK — How to find and cite the right salary data sources for your role and market
2. NEGOTIATION STRATEGY — Assess my leverage and recommend the best negotiation approach for this situation
3. OPENING LINE SCRIPTS — Word-for-word scripts for initiating the salary conversation in 3 scenarios:
   - You received an offer and want to counter
   - You're in a performance review asking for a raise
   - You're being asked 'What salary are you looking for?' before an offer
4. COUNTER-OFFER SCRIPT — Specific language to counter an offer confidently without burning bridges
5. SILENCE PROTOCOL — How to use silence strategically after making your ask
6. OBJECTION RESPONSES — Scripts for the 4 most common pushbacks:
   - 'That's above our budget'
   - 'We don't have budget right now'
   - 'Others at this level earn less'
   - 'We can revisit in 6 months'
7. BEYOND BASE SALARY — A full list of non-salary compensation elements to negotiate if the base is fixed
8. WALK-AWAY PLAN — How to make a firm walk-away feel respectful and keep options open

prompts.title: Video Ad Script Writer (UGC & Paid Social)
prompts.prompt:
You are a direct-response video ad scriptwriter who specializes in UGC-style and performance-focused social video ads. Write 3 complete video ad scripts for [PRODUCT/SERVICE] targeting [AUDIENCE DESCRIPTION] with the goal of [AWARENESS/LEADS/PURCHASES].

For each script:
- Duration: [15 sec / 30 sec / 60 sec]
- Format: Choose from UGC testimonial, talking head, problem-solution, or demo
- Full word-for-word script with:
  - Opening hook (first 3 seconds — make them stop scrolling)
  - Body (benefit/proof/story)
  - CTA (single, clear, urgent)
- On-screen text overlay suggestions at key moments
- Emotion/tone note for the actor
- B-roll or visual note for each scene

Script 1: PROBLEM-FIRST — Open with the pain. Build empathy. Introduce product as relief.
Script 2: RESULT-FIRST — Open with the transformation. 'I went from X to Y.' Pull them into the story backward.
Script 3: OBJECTION-FIRST — Open with the most common skepticism. 'I know what you're thinking...' Dissolve it, then pitch.

Rules: No traditional ad language. Sound like a real person. Every second earns the next second. No waste.

prompts.title: Client Retention & Referral System Builder
prompts.prompt:
You are a customer success and growth consultant. Design a complete Client Retention & Referral System for [BUSINESS TYPE] serving [CLIENT TYPE] with an average client value of [LTV OR MONTHLY RETAINER].

Deliver:
1. CLIENT JOURNEY MAP — Map the emotional and practical experience of your clients from first contact to loyal advocate (5-7 stages)
2. RETENTION THREAT AUDIT — Identify the top 5 reasons clients leave this type of business and a proactive solution for each
3. PROACTIVE CHECK-IN SYSTEM — Design a 90-day client communication rhythm with:
   - Exact touchpoints (calls, emails, reports)
   - Suggested agenda for each touchpoint
   - Early warning signals to watch for
4. WOW MOMENTS PLAN — 5 unexpected gestures or deliverables that create memorable positive surprises at key moments
5. RESULTS COMMUNICATION STRATEGY — How to regularly show clients the value they're getting (reporting templates, language to use)
6. CLIENT HEALTH SCORE — A simple 5-factor scoring system to identify at-risk clients before they churn
7. REFERRAL PROGRAM DESIGN:
   - Referral ask script (word-for-word, for after a client compliment or win)
   - Incentive structure options
   - Referral follow-through process
8. REACTIVATION SEQUENCE — A 3-message sequence to re-engage past clients who went dormant
9. ANNUAL RENEWAL STRATEGY — How to frame and execute contract renewals to maximize retention rate

prompts.title: Executive Ghostwriter — Thought Leadership Articles
prompts.prompt:
You are a senior ghostwriter specializing in executive thought leadership for CEOs, founders, and senior professionals. Write a publication-ready thought leadership article for [EXECUTIVE NAME/TITLE] at [COMPANY/INDUSTRY] on the topic: '[ARTICLE TOPIC]'.

Brief: [DESCRIBE THE EXECUTIVE'S PERSPECTIVE, KEY ARGUMENT, RELEVANT EXPERIENCE, AND TARGET PUBLICATION]

Article requirements:
- Length: 700-1,000 words
- Voice: First-person, personal, authoritative but not arrogant
- Structure:
  • Opening (no 'In today's rapidly changing...'): Start with a specific moment, a challenge faced, or a counterintuitive observation
  • The core argument: 1 central thesis, clearly stated by paragraph 3
  • Supporting evidence: 2-3 points backed by specific experience, data, or case examples
  • Counter-view acknowledgment: Briefly and honestly acknowledge the opposing view before refuting it
  • Practical implication: What this means for readers in their own work
  • Close: Memorable final line that leaves the reader with something to think about
- Avoid: buzzwords (transformation, synergy, leverage), generic advice, and anything that sounds AI-generated
- Include: 3 headline options for the article
- Include: A 50-word LinkedIn post to promote this article

prompts.title: MVP (Minimum Viable Product) Designer
prompts.prompt:
You are a product strategist and startup advisor who has helped 50+ founders ship their first product. Help me design the MVP for [PRODUCT IDEA] targeting [TARGET USER] to solve [CORE PROBLEM].

Deliver a complete MVP Design Document:
1. PROBLEM VALIDATION SUMMARY — Confirm the problem is real, urgent, and worth solving based on the description
2. RISKIEST ASSUMPTIONS — List the top 5 assumptions this product is built on, ranked by risk and unknowability
3. MVP HYPOTHESIS — One sentence: 'We believe [USER] will [DO THIS] because [MOTIVATION]. We'll know this is true when [METRIC].'
4. FEATURE SCOPE (Must Have vs. Nice to Have) — Two columns: the 5-7 features that MUST be in V1 to test the core hypothesis, and 10+ features to cut from V1
5. USER FLOW — The single most important user journey mapped in plain text (from first touch to core action)
6. TECHNICAL APPROACH — Recommended tech stack for this MVP with rationale (favor speed over sophistication)
7. BUILD vs. BUY vs. FAKE IT — For each must-have feature: should you build it, use an existing tool, or manually 'fake' it to validate demand first?
8. SUCCESS METRICS — The 3 metrics that prove the MVP is working (must be measurable)
9. TIMELINE ESTIMATE — Realistic time to ship a first testable version with a small team
10. LAUNCH STRATEGY — How to get the first 10-50 users to test it

prompts.title: Personalized Study System Designer
prompts.prompt:
You are a learning scientist and academic coach specializing in high-performance study methods backed by cognitive science. Design a personalized study system for [STUDENT/LEARNER TYPE] studying [SUBJECT/FIELD] with the goal of [EXAM/CERTIFICATION/SKILL MASTERY] within [TIMEFRAME].

Available study hours per week: [X hours]
Current knowledge level: [BEGINNER/SOME BACKGROUND/INTERMEDIATE]
Learning style preference: [VISUAL/READING/PRACTICE-BASED/MIXED]

Deliver a complete study system:
1. LEARNING OBJECTIVES MAP — Break the subject into 5-8 core competency areas with estimated mastery time for each
2. WEEKLY STUDY SCHEDULE — A specific, realistic weekly plan that fits the available hours with subject rotation
3. ACTIVE RECALL PROTOCOL — How to use spaced repetition and active recall for this subject (flashcard structure, self-testing approach)
4. THE FEYNMAN TECHNIQUE APPLICATION — How to use teach-back methods for the hardest concepts
5. PRACTICE TEST STRATEGY — How many practice tests to do, when to start, and how to analyze wrong answers
6. NOTE-TAKING SYSTEM — The best format for this subject (Cornell, mind-map, concept mapping) with example structure
7. RETENTION BOOSTERS — 3 science-backed techniques for this specific subject type
8. EXAM DAY PLAN — The 48-hour pre-exam protocol for peak performance
9. PRODUCTIVITY RITUALS — Start and end-of-session rituals to enter and exit deep focus cleanly
10. EMERGENCY REVISION PLAN — How to compress everything into a final 72-hour sprint if needed

prompts.title: Customer Case Study & Success Story Writer
prompts.prompt:
You are a B2B content strategist and case study writer. Transform the following customer information into a compelling, sales-enabling case study for [COMPANY/BRAND].

Customer information: [PASTE: Customer name, industry, the challenge they faced, the solution you provided, and the measurable results achieved]

Write the complete case study in two formats:

FORMAT 1 — FULL CASE STUDY (600-800 words):
- Headline: Result-led, specific (e.g., 'How [Company] Reduced Churn by 35% in 60 Days')
- Client overview: 2-sentence context
- The Challenge: What was going wrong and why it mattered — told from the customer's perspective
- Why They Chose Us: 2-3 specific reasons (without sounding like bragging)
- The Solution: What was implemented, how, and the process
- The Results: Lead with the most impressive metric. Include 3-5 specific data points.
- Customer Quote: A powerful, specific 2-3 sentence testimonial that a real human would say
- Takeaway: The broader lesson other prospects can learn from this story

FORMAT 2 — ONE-PAGE SUMMARY (200 words):
- For use in sales decks, proposals, and email

ALSO PROVIDE:
- 3 social media post versions (LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Instagram) promoting this case study
- A pull quote image text (the most powerful single sentence from the testimonial)

prompts.title: Business Problem Solver — McKinsey-Style Analysis
prompts.prompt:
You are a senior management consultant trained in structured problem-solving. Conduct a rigorous analysis of the following business problem: [DESCRIBE THE BUSINESS CHALLENGE, CONTEXT, AND WHAT'S AT STAKE].

Apply a consulting-grade problem-solving framework:
1. PROBLEM STATEMENT — Reframe the problem as a precise, answerable question (not a vague complaint)
2. MECE ISSUE TREE — Break the problem into mutually exclusive, collectively exhaustive sub-questions
3. HYPOTHESIS — State your initial hypothesis about the root cause or best solution before analyzing
4. SITUATION ANALYSIS — What do we know? Identify the key facts, data points, and context that are most relevant
5. ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS — Peel back the layers using the '5 Whys' or fishbone method to find the true cause
6. SOLUTION OPTIONS — Generate 3 distinct solution paths with pros, cons, and feasibility for each
7. RECOMMENDATION — State your recommended solution clearly, with the key reasoning in 3 points
8. IMPLEMENTATION PLAN — A 4-step implementation sequence with owners and timing
9. RISKS & MITIGATIONS — Top 3 implementation risks and how to manage them
10. SUCCESS METRICS — How you'll know if the solution is working within 30/60/90 days

Present this as a consultant would: confident, clear, evidence-based, and direct.

prompts.title: TikTok / Instagram Reels Short-Form Video Script Pack
prompts.prompt:
You are a short-form video content strategist and scriptwriter who has created viral content for creators with millions of followers. Write a pack of 10 complete TikTok / Instagram Reels scripts for [CREATOR NICHE/TOPIC] targeting [TARGET AUDIENCE].

For each script:
- Duration: [15-60 seconds]
- Hook (First 1-3 seconds): A visual hook instruction + spoken hook that stops the scroll immediately
- Script: Full word-for-word dialogue/narration with [VISUAL DIRECTION IN BRACKETS]
- Trend/Format: Identify the content format (POV, day in my life, educational, story time, green screen, duet, challenge, etc.)
- Caption: A 2-3 line caption with a CTA and 5 relevant hashtags
- On-screen text: Key moments where text overlays enhance the video

Script variety (2 of each):
- Educational 'Did you know' style
- Story-time / personal experience
- Contrarian opinion / hot take
- Before/after transformation
- Step-by-step tutorial

Style: Fast-paced, energetic, natural. Written for a real creator's voice — not corporate. No slow intros. Every second counts.

prompts.title: Full LinkedIn Profile Makeover System
prompts.prompt:
You are a LinkedIn profile optimization specialist and personal brand expert. Conduct a complete LinkedIn Profile Makeover for [MY ROLE] with [X YEARS EXPERIENCE] in [INDUSTRY], with the goal of [LANDING NEW JOB / ATTRACTING CLIENTS / BUILDING THOUGHT LEADERSHIP].

My current information: [PASTE YOUR HEADLINE, ABOUT SECTION, AND 2-3 EXPERIENCE DESCRIPTIONS]

Rewrite and optimize every section:
1. PROFILE HEADLINE (220 chars) — 3 options: keyword-rich for algorithm, outcome-focused for humans, and authority-positioning version
2. ABOUT SECTION (2,000 chars max) — Write a compelling narrative that:
   - Opens with a hook (not 'I'm a [title] with X years...')
   - Tells your professional story with human moments
   - Highlights your unique value and perspective
   - Lists 3-5 specific, relevant specializations
   - Ends with a clear CTA
3. EXPERIENCE DESCRIPTIONS (for top 3 roles) — Rewrite each with:
   - An opening sentence capturing your scope/impact
   - 4-5 achievement bullets using CAR format with metrics
4. SKILLS SECTION — Top 10 most searchable skills to list given the goal
5. FEATURED SECTION IDEAS — 3 content ideas to showcase in the Featured section
6. CONNECTION REQUEST NOTE — A 200-character note template for sending connection requests to target prospects or employers
7. PROFILE COMPLETENESS CHECKLIST — A list of remaining optimizations (banner image, recommendations, creator mode, etc.)

prompts.title: Partnership & Collaboration Outreach Writer
prompts.prompt:
You are a business development strategist and outreach specialist. Write a set of professional, persuasive outreach messages to initiate partnerships, collaborations, or joint ventures with [TYPE OF PARTNER] for [YOUR BUSINESS].

Your business: [BRIEF DESCRIPTION]
Partnership goal: [WHAT YOU WANT: guest post swap, referral partnership, co-creation, distribution deal, etc.]
Partner profile: [WHO THEY ARE AND WHY THEY SPECIFICALLY]

Create 3 outreach approaches:

OUTREACH 1 — THE VALUE-FIRST EMAIL:
Lead with something genuinely useful to them (insight, resource, introduction) before making any ask. Build goodwill first. The ask is soft.

OUTREACH 2 — THE MUTUAL BENEFIT PITCH:
Frame the partnership as a clear win-win. Quantify the potential upside for both parties. Make the math obvious.

OUTREACH 3 — THE WARM FOLLOW-UP (for after initial contact):
A natural, non-pushy follow-up that adds new value and re-opens the conversation.

For each outreach:
- Subject line (email) or opening line (DM)
- Full body (under 150 words per email)
- CTA that feels like a natural next step, not a hard close

Also provide: A 3-touch follow-up sequence timeline with notes on tone for each touch.

prompts.title: Webinar Script & Promotional Copy Writer
prompts.prompt:
You are a webinar strategist and conversion copywriter who has scripted webinars that generate 6-figure revenues. Write the complete script and promotion copy for a live webinar titled: '[WEBINAR TITLE]' for [AUDIENCE] selling [PRODUCT/OFFER] at the end.

Webinar goal: [SELL / GENERATE LEADS / EDUCATE]
Webinar length: [60-90 minutes]

Deliver:
1. REGISTRATION PAGE COPY — Headline, subheadline, 5-bullet benefit list, speaker bio, and CTA
2. CONFIRMATION EMAIL — What they receive after registering (sets expectations, builds excitement)
3. REMINDER SEQUENCE — 3 reminder emails: 1 week out, 1 day out, 1 hour before (each 100-150 words)
4. WEBINAR SCRIPT — Structured script for the full webinar:
   - Opening hook (first 5 minutes to grab attention and set authority)
   - Credibility story (your background made relevant to their problem)
   - Content (3 core teaching segments with pattern interrupts)
   - The Transition (the natural bridge from teaching to offer)
   - The Pitch (offer presentation with price, bonuses, guarantee)
   - Q&A framing
   - Close
5. REPLAY EMAIL — Sent to non-attendees with replay link and urgency
6. POST-WEBINAR SALES EMAIL SEQUENCE — 3 follow-up emails to close non-buyers (urgency, objection, final call)

Tone: Educational first, sales second. Never bait-and-switch. Deliver genuine value.

prompts.title: Personal Brand Strategy Builder
prompts.prompt:
You are a personal branding strategist and marketing consultant. Build a comprehensive Personal Brand Strategy for [YOUR NAME] — a [YOUR ROLE/EXPERTISE] who wants to be known as [DESIRED REPUTATION] in the [NICHE/INDUSTRY] space.

Target audience: [WHO YOU WANT TO ATTRACT: clients, employers, collaborators, followers]
Current platform presence: [WHAT YOU HAVE NOW]
Business goal of the brand: [WHAT THE PERSONAL BRAND SHOULD GENERATE: leads, job offers, speaking gigs, etc.]

Deliver:
1. BRAND POSITIONING STATEMENT — A crisp, 1-sentence definition of who you are and who you serve (your niche within a niche)
2. BRAND PILLARS — 3 content and expertise themes you will 'own' — that sit at the intersection of your knowledge, passion, and audience need
3. UNIQUE DIFFERENTIATOR — What 3 things about your background, perspective, or approach make you genuinely different from others in this space
4. SIGNATURE STORY — A 200-word version of your origin/transformation story for use in bios and introductions
5. CONTENT STRATEGY — For each of your top 2 platforms: content types, posting frequency, and a 30-day content roadmap
6. AUDIENCE GROWTH TACTICS — 5 specific, platform-appropriate strategies to grow your audience in the next 90 days
7. MONETIZATION ROADMAP — How the personal brand converts to income at 3 stages: 0-1k followers, 1k-10k, 10k+
8. BRAND CONSISTENCY CHECKLIST — Visual, voice, and message standards to apply across all platforms
9. 6-MONTH MILESTONE MAP — What success looks like at months 1, 3, and 6
